info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 6:15PM PDT until July 27 at 9:15PM PDT by NWS Reno NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of east central California, including the following county, Alpine and western Nevada, including the Tamarack Burn Scar and the following county, Douglas.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Heavy rains on Tamarack Burn Scar may cause flooding.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 614 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.1 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tamarack Burn Scar, Holbrook Junction. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Recent burn areas are more prone to flooding, debris flows, and rock falls. Plugged culverts, rocks and debris on roads, and water and mud over roads are common during moderate to heavy rains. Increased sediment and debris can lead to impacts in areas typically not prone to flooding. Use extra caution when traveling in or below recent burn areas. Impactful flooding and debris flows may be generated by 15 minutes or less of heavy rainfall.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM PDT THIS EVENING
